intro: Glossorhyncha keysseri, commonly known as the red-flowered orchid, is a rare and striking member of the Orchidaceae family. It is characterized by its vibrant red petals and sepals, which are often adorned with intricate patterns. Native to the mountainous regions of Southeast Asia, this species thrives in humid, shaded environments. Its unique floral structure attracts specific pollinators, contributing to its ecological significance. Due to habitat loss, Glossorhyncha keysseri is considered endangered and requires conservation efforts to ensure its survival.
